\Aura\Cli

\Aura\CliAbstractCommand

The CLI equivalent of a page-controller to perform a single action.

Properties

$getopt

$getopt : \Aura\Cli\Aura\Cli\Getopt

A Getopt object for the Command; retains the short and long options passed at the command line.

Type

\Aura\Cli\Aura\Cli\Getopt

$options

$options : array

The option definitions for the Getopt object.

Type

array

Tags

todo

$options_strict

$options_strict : bool

Should Getopt be strict about how options are processed? In strict mode, passing an undefined option will throw an exception; in non-strict, it will not.

Type

bool

Tags

todo

$params : array

Tags

todo

exec()

exec() : void

Executes the Command. In order, it does these things:

  • signals pre_exec, thereby calling preExec()

  • loads $getopt and sets $params

  • signals pre_action, thereby calling preAction()

  • calls action()

  • signals post_action, thereby calling postAction()

  • signals post_exec, thereby calling postExec()

  • signals catch_exception when a exception is thrown, thereby

    calling catchException()

  • resets the terminal to normal

  • returns the $return code

See also

Tags

todo

Tags

preExec()

preExec() : void

Runs at the beginning of `exec()` before `preAction()`.

Tags

todo

preAction()

preAction() : mixed

Runs before `action()` but after `preExec()`.

Returns

mixed

Tags

todo

postAction()

postAction() : mixed

Runs after `action()` but before `postExec()`.

Returns

mixed

Tags

todo

postExec()

postExec() : mixed

Runs at the end of `exec()` after `postAction()`.

Returns

mixed
